WRITING.TEXT: YTA. You're grossly insecure and she should break up with you.

My favorite shift is night shift! In my agency, the day shifters (officers and dispatch alike) are all senior (as in seniority, lol) people and its just hard to connect with them (I'm 20). To stay awake on nights, I MDT with the officers or strike conversation with the other dispatchers. As for staying healthy, I tend to bring salads for lunch and walk around comm center during the slow periods or do squats because it gets boring lol. On night shift, I notice I sleep a lot less (9 hours on day shift vs 4 hours on nights), which generally helps with productivity during the day when I need to clean or walk the dogs or whatever normal people do lol. I also prefer nights because, since the activity is slower, there's more time to do homework for students or catch up on assignments.

ESH. 7 is definitely old enough to know not to harass animals or smear shit everywhere in someone else's house. OP should've just continued saying no to babysitting based on the simple fact they don't like kids. Sister sucks for guilting OP into babysitting knowing they didn't want to. I agree, to an extent, that when you're left in charge of a child you're responsible for their discipline, but not locking them in a room like a dog. Help them clean the mess they made (to show you're a good role model) and stick them in a corner for a few minutes as punishment.
What the hell? Did you report it to higher ups?
Glad to hear! Sorry you had to deal with it in the first place, though.

**YTA.** He prefers he/him pronous; use he/him pronouns. Instead of saying girlfriend/boyfriend, just say partner. It's not hard to respect someone else's identity. If you don't care if they think you're gay, who fucking cares if you call him your boyfriend?
Definitely NTA. Your friend seems incredibly manipulative and narcissistic.
It says it isn't assigned parking

NTA. I'm relatively heavily tattooed myself and I think it's super cool seeing people with similar tattoos as mine. I see why you're reluctant, though. Recently, a girl I was friends with, like, 6 years ago got a new tattoo that is very similar to one I got after losing touch with her (about 3 years ago) and I told her that we now had similar tattoos and she was pissed.
I failed mine (technically) and still got the job! My agency goes by which sections are most important and makes sure you pass those sections! For us, our total score doesn't matter. Chin up!!!!

WRITING.TITLE: How do y'all deal with awful supervisors?
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, all! #8203; I'm a rookie dispatcher (10 months on the job) and we went through a huge comm. center shift in supervisors, including getting a new manager. TLDR, the manager and one supervisor retired at the same time, making a supervisor a manager and leaving only one super. To cope with this, we NEEDED people to step up into the super positions ((due to short staffing)), one on eves and one on mids. They both have about 6 years experience and 3 years CTO experience. The mids super is fantastic; she's patient, willing to help whenever, and often helps on our shift to fill scheduling gaps on her days off. The eves super (my direct supervisor) is not so nice. She consistently belittles rookies (there's 3 people in training and 6 people fresh out of training, me being one of them), yells at officers on the radio, snaps at other dispatchers for asking questions, etc... I've worked in the food industry since I was 16 (I'm 21 now) and have been the manager in any restaurant I've worked in, so I've never had to deal with a bad supervisor before. She's just so mean lol. Not even callers are like this.... Help or advice is appreciated.
Hello I work in brevard. I #8217;m dying after all these shootings these last two weeks and I feel you on the burn out lol
YTA and you're controlling. Red flags all around.

Polygraphs are not accurate and are actually inadmissible in courts in my state. They are more of a "stress test" to see your physical reaction to things. My agency did not use a hair test, but used a urine test. I have been in close proximity to potheads pretty much my whole life without actually smoking and have never failed a drug test. Hope all goes well for him!

Dress comfortably but professionally and don't sweat it too much! Remember to breathe. I was 15 minutes early for mine and I literally sat in my PD's lobby by myself the whole time and I did my observation immediately after.
NTA. Anyone who deadnames you, regardless of how long you've used that name, is an automatic asshole. It shouldn't take that many tries to respect you and your identity.

It #8217;s not ridiculous to want someone to respect your identity lmao it #8217;s been 5 months since OP has said what they prefer to go by, which is plenty of time to get used to it. An apology means nothing without changed behavior.

Mine was a three hour appointment with a 300 question test (it was pretty much like 4 of the same question just asked in different ways) and a 20 minute appointment with a psychologist to make sure I was mentally fit for the nature of the job. Easy peasy :)

I started at 20, too! I just turned 21 lol. The interview for me was super stressful because I'd never had a panel style interview before and the agency I work for is about two hours from where I lived my whole life, so I wasn't at all familiar with the area. Remember to be calm and self-assured. This is a stressful, but rewarding job. You'll do great :)

We work rotating 12s, so we have 2 on, 2 off, 3 on, 2 off, 2 on, 3 off. It was a confusing switch at first, but we have a lot less MOT, a lot less sick leave, and a lot more days off, so it works for us. We each have every other weekend off, which is nice. Our comm center has 28 full time and 6 part time. Edit: We use 4 shifts, each with at least 5 people on it, with more people on day shift and two people on a swing shift. A amp;B shift work 0700-1900 and C amp;D work 1900-0700 with the swing shifts being 1100-2300 on either A or B shift's days.
YTA. You sound like an entitled asshole and a generally bad person. What do you care about her looks for? She's not your wife, lmao. Hope this helps.
Wow, thought I wrote this myself for a minute, but replace mom with cousin, lol. NTA.

I'm at a 2g (which is obviously very different in size from 5/8ths lol), but I also have a lot of other ear piercings and two nose piercings. It's really agency specific, but in my experience it doesn't matter tooooooo much. Good luck!

I work night shift (1900-0700 on a rotating schedule-- 2 on, 2 off, 3 on, 2 off, 2 on, 3 off) and I prefer it this way. I'm young and in college, so it's easier for me to do schoolwork this way, though my social life suffers. On my off days, I tend to fall asleep around 3 or 4am so I can spend time with my S/O the following day while maintaining a day sleep schedule. I get tea from the local McDonalds but I try to avoid actual energy drinks because they wear me down lol.
YTA and you're sexist. Hopefully it doesn't leave a lasting impression on her and she will feel comfortable doing what she wants without asking for your approval, since she's basically an adult.

I wish my mom had had this thought process. She has a few tattoos and her lobes pierced, but supported me getting my ears pierced to my hearts desire; that being said, when I asked for my nostril/septum to be pierced (age 16) she told me no, so I did it myself. There weren't any complications, but it definitely caused a rift in our relationship. The day after I turned 18 I went and got it done professionally. I asked her to sign off on a tattoo for me when I was 16 and she said no to that, too, so I got it done illegally and behind her back. Kudos to you for knowing that it's just self-expression! You sound like a really good parent.

My childhood best friend went undiagnosed with an autoimmune disease for 20 years and it ultimately took her life last December, two months after her 21st birthday. Because of this, I'm hyper-aware of my loved ones' health and insist they see doctors often. Keep fighting the fight and remember you are loved regardless of any health issues. Please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you ever need a shoulder to cry on. lt;3

ESH. She shouldn't have come at you sideways and you shouldn't have used your loud neighbors are an excuse. You need to report your loud neighbors to the leasing office/landlord or write a note asking them to be quieter. That being said, if my downstairs neighbor came to my door and started yelling at me, I would've handled it probably the same way, if not worse lol. #8203; I've had issues with my neighbors being loud in the past, but in my experience a quick email to the leasing office generally solves the issue, or at least reminds them they have neighbors.

YTA. He literally could've died and his accident had nothing to do with you; you were not effected at all. Yes, drinking and driving was stupid, but you're literally wishing ill will on someone, which is bad karma to you. Motorcycle accidents are the most dangerous form of accidents; riders have little to no protection and had the circumstances been different, he literally could have died.
My dad is an identical mirror twin, and I've never thought of my cousins this way. That's super funny and awesome at the same time
NTA, fuck that guy. The police would probably not come out for that situation or even entertain him, so he really had no leverage anyway. Source: I'm a 911/police dispatcher.
NTA. Both my parents had cancer when I was 16 and they were both denied care takers. People like her are the reason why. Fuck your friend and her family for being on board with that notion.

YTA. 911 dispatcher here. This is more often than not agency policy. 911 calls automatically generate calls for service and you cannot close a call out unless there is an address, and depending on that agency specifically, that call may hold there for an undetermined amount of time until someone puts an address in the call. You can literally say "I live at 123 Main St, but my family and I are about to head out to run some errands. If you would like an officer/deputy to check on us, we will be back around x time." We have a hard enough job without someone being rude to us over the phone over us wanting to ENSURE YOUR CHILD IS OKAY.
I've gone through something similar. Two years, two months, and 9 days. They made an arrest last week. You are strong. They are in everything and that is beautiful.

I worked at McDonald's as a manager, an ice cream shop as a manager, and Cracker Barrel as a server. I was in college for Political Science at a private college two hours north of where I now work. I did volunteer work in high school with kids in need. My mother was a dispatcher and my stepdad was an officer; I still want to be a teacher and am using this to get back into school to finish that goal. While I love what I do, it's not my forever career, though I do hope to be able to do this part time as a teacher.
I agree with you 100% but the "ok boomer" girl defends necrophilia which is wild to me lmao ((those two things are obviously unrelated, I just think about that every time I see a post abt her))

This is a relatively common coping mechanism that sexual assault survivors have. CNC sex is a thing and is a kink even non-survivors have. As others have said, therapy will probably help. It's important, if you do go to therapy, to be honest and let your walls down. I'm sorry that that happened to you; know that you're not alone.

This is assault. Your father was very much awake when that happened and he was gaslighting you when it was brought up after the fact. I'm sorry that happened, but am glad you have a therapist that can help.

Being deaf or HoH, or having partial hearing loss, is not a disability. While it may not necessarily be a \~blessing\~ it's definitely not a bad thing. YTA for thinking it is and for having such a harsh reaction to your friend saying what she said. Is she deaf/HoH? You belittled her. Get involved in the deaf community in your area and realize how special and awesome it is. #8203; Edit: grammar/spelling

I would call the local law enforcement and ask them how to proceed with this. In my area, they would refer you to the court system, but it's worth a shot to just get advice from someone who sorta knows the law. If an officer/deputy can't help, a lot of attorneys do free consultations.
ESH, but him slightly more. He sucks for being aggressive, you suck for being aggressive. Did you consider that he may have been deaf/HoH or mute?
NTA. I do this every. single. time. this happens to me lmao my boyfriend hates it, but pedestrians have the right of way and people are shitty drivers lol
NTA. Next time they ask, say that's your biological dog; it's what I do.

NTA. She's literally upset over spilled milk, you're upset because you're going through, probably, a ton of puberty right now and she yelled at you. Puberty is rough and it can cause your mood swings. Hope you feel better soon, bud.
No changes, other than no officers/medics allowed in dispatch and we aren't allowed to sit within 6 feet of each other (we're a small center).
NAH except for your friends/family who don't support your decision. You seem like a genuinely good person amp; I hope the best for you and your family
YTA. Dogs are family members, not accessories that you can throw away when you want. Hope you don't treat your kid like that.

He is transphobic if the sole reason he won't have sex with you is that you're trans. You've stated you're cis-passing and entirely post-op, so there is absolutely no reason for him to want to have sex with a cis-female instead of you, other than internalized transphobia.

NAH. She's trying to look out for your future (I wish my parents had pushed me for scholarships, maybe then I wouldn't have ended up with so much student debt), but she's doing it in a way you don't appreciate. Ask her to slow it down a little, maybe one full day of schoolwork + one scholarship application a day? Edit: grammar
ESH. Cheating is never, ever okay. Pressuring someone to kiss you is never ever okay. You should've told her as soon as it happened, fuck what Steve thinks.
Congrats on being the world's biggest dumbass.
YTA. and you're racist, no matter how "mildly racist" you think you are. You're just racist.

It is incredibly common. In high school during my senior finals/state exams, I missed my period for 11 weeks. Stress can make you late, a change in pH balance (sometimes caused by sex) can make you late, it could be an underlying health issue.
NTA. This sounds like sexual assault and he's fucking weird. Sexual favors in the past have no bearing on the present.
NAH, but depending on where you are, it may even be illegal for him to have it pierced ((professionally)) while he's under 16.

Being cat called isn't validating. It's scary. You never know how that interact could end. If you ignore it, you could be further harassed. If you acknowledge it positively, you could be further harassed. If you acknowledge it negatively, you could be killed. Your validation shouldn't come from men being gross. Regardless of how you perceive yourself, you will always be beautiful to someone.
They can compliment without catcalling lol they are too very different things
All good, friend :)
YTA and you're emotionally manipulative.
NAH. You can still respect their trans identity while not wanting to have sex with them. Having a genital preference is okay.
YTA and you likely expected the same of the 21 yo and that's why she doesn't talk to you anymore. 14 year olds should be enjoying adolescence, not raising kids. This is probably why she has anxiety.
I'm a night owl, too, and I work overnights (7pm-7am) and I relate to this heavily

WRITING.TITLE: Happy Telecommunicators Week!
WRITING.TEXT: Hopefully y'all get the appreciation you deserve!

Remember that the calls are other people's problems, not yours. It's okay to take a call home with you, just don't let it stay with you forever. You're there to help them in their time of need, not take over their problems entirely. This job is very rewarding and you'll meet lots of great people! Enjoy it and good luck!
If you feel guilty, tell your parents. You're 15, a kid yourself; you shouldn't be looking after all of your younger siblings. You weren't the one that drew on the notebook.

YTA, if not for being super petty, then for coming here asking for sympathy points because you're "a super kind and nice person," while simultaneously proving to us that you're neither of those things lol
It's different for every agency. I, personally, didn't even pass my CritiCall test, but was hired anyway lol. I don't think you did poorly, but again it depends on the agency you applied with
YIKES, but I guess a congratulations are in order?? So congrats, if it's a good thing for you lol
NTA if you're genuinely trying to be quiet like you say you are lol. Thin walls suck, but there's only so much you can do without impeding on your own routine in your own home.

NAH. She has autism and depression, both of those things can affect memory. Not to mention it's only been three months, which is not a lot of time. You knowing those things about her doesn't necessitate her knowing it about you. Don't "lecture" her, communicate with her that it hurts your feelings.

YTA. Communal space is not your extra storage space. If you had *so* much stuff in your house that you didn't know you had a leak, you have a huge issue. Don't stock up on stuff to resell until you've sold what you already have because you're causing stress for your husband and your neighbors with your current plan. #8203; Maybe, in the future after all of this is over, convert the second bedroom into *just* storage space instead of storage space and a guest room? Or buy industrial shelving units to make it fit better?
I'm sorry that you were bullied as a child, but please don't take it out on an entire continent. Brazilians didn't bully you and my 4 year old Mexican neighbor didn't bully you. I hope you heal.

Map reading was my worst scoring one somehow lol. On ours, we had a section where we had to read scenarios and determine which one was most important (EMS call with CPR in progress vs an unoccupied structure fire vs a domestic) and we couldn #8217;t explain why we chose what we did and they didn #8217;t like my answers lol

Honestly, they're looking for honesty. My mom is a probation officer for the same city I work in, so one of the questions the manager asked me was "If you had just taken a call that your mother was shot in the line of duty at work, how would you respond?" Obviously the answer I wanted to give was "just react like I would react to any other gunshot wound call," but I was honest and said "I haven't been in that situation, so I can't tell you exactly how I would respond." That's the answer that set me apart from the other interviewees-- my honesty. My interview as a panel style interview and it was recorded, which scared me lol. As for real questions, they vary from agency to agency, so it's hard to tell what to expect. My best advice is to be honest, be yourself, and answer as best you can to your ability, even if you have no idea what the answer is lol #8203; Good luck!
YTA and if my SO did this to me, especially consistently like Jack suggests in his post, I would've broke up with him a long, long time ago.

YTA. My aunt did this to my cousins (NOT positive reinforcement btw) and it ruined her relationship with them. My oldest cousin, after turning 18 and moving out, still has not spoken to her mother and it's been 9 years. 16 is old enough to know better and "asses" is barely even a bad word lol.

Honestly, you'd have better luck in Orlando lol, but Viera is good if you don't have a specific price limit (the shops there are great!), Palm Bay/ Melbourne are probably the best areas for dating though. Cocoa Village is a cute, smaller place for dates, when you do find someone!

I mean, on one hand, that friend could be a predator, in that she is 10 years your brother's senior and they started seeing each other before he was of legal age, so the friend is... not great. On the other, your mother is likely inviting her because the friend is the mother of her grandchild. I'd talk to your mother about how you feel like she's pushing you away and gently bring up how seeing her consistently makes you feel. She probably doesn't know it's hurting you.

NAH, though I do side with you more than him; it's your body and your past so it's not necessary to disclose that, but I also so why he may be upset. Personally, I think him inadvertently blaming your failing is his midterm is shitty, but only because that's a standard manipulation tactic.

I only have a high school diploma and have only ever worked in the food industry; qualifications aren't that important lol. But I will caution you against this line of work unless you have a stable place to live, if not for the hiring process/training, then for your background check. This is a lifetime career and is already a rotating door at a lot of agencies.
Mine does too!! It #8217;s her favorite!

We have two dispatchers in our center that are having very, very similar issues. One (we #8217;ll call her Megan) gets very flustered when people tell her she #8217;s doing something wrong, or when they get snippy at all. She is also extroverted, but her shift mates are introverts. They switched her shift and CTO to our shift and she #8217;s doing loads better now. So maybe a change of shift would help him? With more patient, for lack of better term, dispatchers? The other one (Sarah) is incredibly introverted and also on our shift (full of extroverts). She was also put on our shift to build confidence, but it really just isn #8217;t working. Our manager wants to dismiss her but our shift is #8220;the nice one, #8221; so we #8217;re all trying to help her. With her having such a poor radio ear, she listens to the scanner on her off days and tries to decipher what #8217;s going on. After work, we all watch the same shows, so we have her summarize the latest episode to pick up on important parts. As for sense of urgency, that #8217;s not something I think can be taught, other than a reminder they peoples #8217; lives could be on the line? Lol Hope everything goes well for you and your rookie amp; hope you #8217;re all staying safe :)
Definitely NTA. Cut your step-family and your dad off completely. I'm glad you put your foot down

As for legal advice, it would be very difficult, if even possible, to get a restraining order based on a gut feeling and not physical evidence. I'm not a parent, so I can't weigh in on the parenting side of it (I follow this sub for the wholesome content lol). Speak with local law enforcement to find out the requirements to petition for the restraining order.

YTA. Your child should always come first. You broke your daughter's heart and now she's reacting to it; if your girlfriend had allergies, she shouldn't have moved in. Animals are a lifelong commitment, not toys.

NTA and I wouldn't apologize lol. I also come from a large, Southern family (almost 300 spread across the south), but my own Big Gay Wedding won't have homophobes or their shitty kids/grands, no matter how badly I want a big wedding. The other 20 people are only not going because Sweet Gale has some tea to hold over their heads and they can't have their \~reputations\~ ruined.

I've only been at the job for a year and three months, but what helps me is remembering these are *other people's* problems, not mine. It helps me separate my life from theirs so I don't get too attached to the problems/ the callers. Outside of work to deal with stress, I craft, like making blankets or whatever. My previous supervisor literally gave me panic attacks every time she asked me a question because she was the absolute worst. I'm on midnights again and it's helped me a lot with the call volume. If you ever need to talk, my DMs are open to you, always. Be well and stay safe.
Definitely NTA. Not showering for that long is disgusting, regardless of how dry his skin and flaky his skin is. Break up with him for being a lazy, manipulative shit.

YTA, the father should've decided this on his own, as, clearly, the bio mom knows no boundaries and neither do you. You're her dad's partner, not married partner, from what is says in the post, so you should not be doing any disciplining for someone that's almost a legal adult. Also YTA for being intentionally vague about ages and how far your relationship with your spouse goes. Edit: typo

You shouldn't ever compare yourself to someone else; you go through different things, you know different things, you're good at different things. Maybe try picking up a new hobby? Or taking a class that's out of the ordinary for your general likes? It may help diversify you and show you something you never knew you liked! IMO, being successful should be measured in happiness, so focus on yourself and making yourself happy!
This is beautiful and I'm so happy you're here to share with us! Well wishes to you and your family!

WRITING.TITLE: People are so cruel to one another.
WRITING.TEXT: I'm a 911/police/fire/medical dispatcher. Last night we had an elderly gentleman go missing from his house at 7:30pm and wasn't reported until 11pm. Around 2am we found we had sufficient evidence to issue a Silver Alert (for those not familiar, it's a statewide broadcast that is a "be on the lookout" for an elderly person with a diminished mental capacity, such as dementia). At such time, we sent out a mass notification to all those *who signed up for* these notifications; they come in the form of text message and phone call/voicemail. Since that message went out at 2:30am, we've gotten dozens of calls where people are complaining about the calls waking them up, how they want to complain to the sergeant or police chief or whoever will listen about how they didn't want to be woken up. #8203; One woman called in and straight up said to me "This old man running away is not an emergency to me. I signed up for these COUNTYWIDE notifications in case something happened to my family member. I don't care about this guy going missing." and when I tried to explain to her how to opt out of the notifications, she hung up on me after telling me again she didn't care. #8203; How can people be so cruel to each other? This old man is their neighbor, their child's friend's grandpa, a member of our community, he's a person. How can no one but us, and his family, care? Edit: update! The male has been found and he is safe!
I just?? Why are people like this?

Personally, I wouldn't move. Long distance relationships can work and you guys can always visit with each other or meet half way for a little vacation? Like New Orleans or Atlanta, Savannah... somewhere like that!
She sounded old herself, so I was like? If you go missing do you not want people to look for you?
It #8217;s ridiculous! The city I work for is pretty small, so she definitely knows him in some capacity. It breaks my heart
NTA, but as a Floridian, I see violence here frequently with the victims being Hispanic/Latinx. He has his reasons and they may be more than what he's telling you.

YTA in a big way. Siblings have a special bond, especially twins. My dad is going to be 48 this year and has lived separate from his twin for three cumulative years in their *entire lives*. #8203; Your boyfriend and his sister love each other, they're affectionate, they're siblings. You say you would never slutshame anyone, but you're literally doing that by bringing up how your boyfriend dresses (and his past sexual relationships) AND how the sister dresses. You're sexualizing both your boyfriend and his sister in such a weird way. Telling a lesbian she needs a boyfriend, even if it's meant to be a joke, is homophobic and misogynistic. #8203; You definitely *are* the jealous type. You need to apologize to every person in that house and your boyfriend should break up with you.
For my agency, it was a vision and hearing test and #8220;can you lift up to 50lbs? Yes? Okay, good #8221;

WRITING.TITLE: Daisy #8217;s learning how to drive, but she #8217;s not the greatest at keep her eyes on the road

WRITING.TEXT: (Side note: we were parked when this happened.)

Yes!! Daisy #8217;s weight has been too low for most seatbelts we #8217;ve found in our area (she was underweight when we adopted her and we #8217;ve only had her for two months), but she finally got up to 11 pounds, so she #8217;s big enough for doggy seatbelts!
She #8217;s Daisy May after princess daisy from Mario and may as in aunt May from Spider-Man!
"The meaning is that I saw it and wanted it on my body," is always my response lol. Some tattoos have meaning, some don't; it's no one's business either way.

My parents got divorced when I was very young and never really got along after that. My dad drew a photo for me and I got it tattooed on my 18th birthday, but I didn't tell my mom what special meaning it had to me until I was 20. It's up to you who you share information with and when/if you share it. Personally, I believe that no one should care what anyone else is doing unless it directly effects (affects?) them. It's entirely your call, but I'm sure you'll find the right solution for you :)

I never met with a background detective, other than my sergeant asking for my cell phone and going through my social media, so I can't speak to that. For my polygraph, it was basically "have you ever done drugs?" "have you ever broken a law, if so what law and why?" "what tattoos or piercings do you have and would you get more without permission?" Just kind of weird, general questions that pertain to the code of conduct for my agency specifically.
Clarify during the polygraph, "yes, but it was done so legally and hasn't been done since x date." If they have anymore questions, they can ask and so can your hiring manager/person

Hey! Feelings are feelings regardless of gender; you're a man and you have feelings and that's okay! Have you considered getting child protective services involved? You can fight the fight and you can win! If you ever need anything or any advice, or just someone to vent to, please DM me! I promise I'm LGBT+ friendly and will do my best to help! Please stay safe and remember you are loved
Totally understand! Like I said, though, if you ever wanna vent to an objective third party or anything, I'm all ears! Life gets tough sometimes and that's okay and it's okay to need help!

YTA and there's obviously missing information. Why does her husband dislike you? What other emotional damage have you caused your friend? Don't ever give out someone's private information to someone else, regardless of their relationship or your intentions.
A dispatcher for a police department, yes

I also work near Volusia and lived in DeLand for school! While I haven't been, my coworkers have toured the facility during a class and they say it's beautiful and a well-oiled machine. They seem to work well together in the comm center and are generally nice on the phone. #8203; The pay is worth it, but if you plan on living in Volusia, I'd steer clear from Daytona. The south end of the county is nice!

Small-ish city, 35k population; I was only tested during the hiring process (two years ago), but we're tested at random, and I've had one coworker who's had to go in for it almost every 6 or 8 months.
Well, that #8217;s just on my shift lol. Others have been tested, though less frequently, and I have no idea about the other three shifts because I don #8217;t ever see them
Sorry, I just saw this! 16-18 is actually a lot more than what most departments make down here; a lot of them start at $14 an hour or less

Also a Floridian and an essential worker, it's crazy how little people here care about their own health lol. Just because the state is open doesn't mean it *should* be open!! Hope you and your family are safe and healthy!

Please report this to your manager and the police/ local authorities. This is a dangerous and scary situation that I, myself, have been in. You're likely not the first he's tried to pressure like this. Be safe and always carry protection with you, even if it's just a set of keys between your knuckles.

Body cams are provided by the agency to the officers, so there is likely a policy in place regarding them. If anything happens, remember they can at the very least be fired or reprimanded for violating policy, so if it happens, be sure to fight it! As to why the turn their body cams off, I can only assume it's with malicious intent.
Cumming in you without permission is sexual assault. He is toxic and manipulative. Please break up with him

WRITING.TITLE: Changing agencies?
WRITING.TEXT: Has anyone left one agency for a different one? How do/did you deal with the guilt of leaving your friends from the current agency? Or anxiety about having to learn all new signals/10 codes, making new friends, etc?? Any advice is appreciated!

Thank you! Right now I work with about 8-11 officers and 4 other dispatchers at a time, but I #8217;ll be switching from a small city to a completely different county, where I #8217;ll have 100+ deputies and 30 other dispatchers! It #8217;ll for sure be a big change for me and I #8217;m trying to learn as much as I can before I even start the background check haha
Not an attorney, but if it's a well known chain, call their corporate or regional office and talk to them about it.
If they ever owned the property, they should be have an answer, or at least be able to transfer that reservation to a different one of their properties!

NTA. Bridesmaid sucks for inviting herself, bride sucks for not including her bridesmaid to bridal party events, and you're just trying to keep the peace between bridesmaid and bride, though I definitely get why bride thinks she's being annoying. Personally, I think the bride sucks the most in this situation- why ask someone to be a bridesmaid and then intentionally exclude them from bridesmaid things?
NTA, but "calm your tits," at least where I'm from, is a pretty normal phrase lol. Jane was rude and you stood up for the other girl. Jane wasn't a good friend to begin with, it seems.

What I would do is just ask Jen. I would say something along the lines of "hey, I feel like we've been drifting apart lately. Are you mad at me?" and if she says yes, try to talk about it and ask why she's been so mean. If she says no, say something like "we have a mutual friend who said you were mad at me." Honestly though, 13 for girls is such a formative year, I would drop her as a friend entirely. I had a similar issue when I was around that age and I just stopped being friends with her, because if she'll lie to my face about being my friend, what else can she like to me about? #8203; Good luck!

When I was 14, I found I made most of my friends in settings I was most comfortable in, like coffee shops or open mic night at different places. That way you already know you have at least one similar interest. Also, be safe on Omegle lol

My agency requires we give our first name for admin calls. "City police department communications, this is subject9206, how can I help you?" In our city, the callers couldn't care less what our names are, they just want a quick response time; it's our \[outdated\] policy that says we have to. If they ask for a last name, we just repeat our first names and give our badge numbers.
You can always try again at a different agency later! Especially now that you have a good idea of the different job functions we do. Good luck in your future endeavors!
Aw, 12s aren't so bad lol. Personally, call taking is my least favorite console to work, so more power to you, friend. :)

WRITING.TITLE: Dark humor vs being a dick
WRITING.TEXT: So, I work in a career field that almost requires a dark sense of humor. Most of us use it as a coping mechanism and that's fine, but at what point does it stop being dark humor and start being a shitty person? We took a call today where someone was attacked by a homeless person and my coworker said "Maybe she learned her lesson about helping homeless people," and I just got so angry. Victim blaming and dehumanizing the homeless all in one sentence? Wtf, man.

Hey, she did rape you. If you don't want to call it rape, that's okay, but what she did was assault. You can revoke consent at any time. Given that you haven't had sex since then, maybe it's a subconscious push to help you deal with trauma? Sometimes we have trauma we don't know about and it manifests itself in weird ways. I'm sorry that that happened and I wish you the very best.

First of all, I would consider reporting my coworker to management/HR/whoever for violating the current policy of not having outside people in the house. Amanda showing up put those peoples' lives at an unnecessary risk. Second, Amanda seems actually crazy, so I'd take anything she says with a grain of salt and keep my distance from her. It is very strange that she outed her daughter to a stranger, but wouldn't tell her "friend" that she's gay. Amanda is mad that you told your coworker because she thinks being gay is a sin, so she's embarrassed someone else knows her daughter is a sinner. I'd just ignore her and stay far away from her if at all possible.

I had a similar drunk encounter with a friend (not spouse, so it's a bit different, I'm sure) when I was 16 and I didn't tell anyone until I was 19, so I definitely feel you. It's scary talking about it, but talking can be healing. If you ever need to talk to anyone, my DMs are open to you, friend! Be safe and be well!
Yeah, for sure, but not in this scenario, I don't think it's appropriate, y'know?
He laughed afterwards, so it's my assumption he thought it would be funny

Remember it's for the greater good! I'm not a huge fan of needles either, but when I have to have blood drawn or whatever, I find I take the pain easier if I can watch the needle go in? If that makes sense? However you handle this, you're gonna do great! Good luck with nursing school!

I had a similar situation with my old roommates, one semester in dorms, one year in an apartment and neither of them ever cleaned. I ended up leaving my part of the lease early and they had someone else take over my bedroom/part of the lease through the complex. If that's an option for you, definitely do it, or talk to the landlord about it and explain the situation. Suggest to her that if she doesn't want to clean, she could hire a maidservice or you could split the cost of one, if that's in your budget

NTA. My paternal grandmother dislikes me because she hates my mom and I was basically ignored my entire childhood, and now into adulthood (I'm nearing 22), and pale in comparison to my 8 cousins. I'm the third born of her grandchildren and I haven't seen her or talked to her since I graduated high school, almost 4 years ago. Cut your grandma off and if your dad is still upset over it and tries to force a relationship, cut him off, too.
If you at least know the country/state they live in, it can help. All they need to be able to find an address, a lot of times, is a first/last name and birthday.

If your parents are fine wasting that much money a month, let them, but tell your teacher you'd rather a more advanced approach or suggest to your parents that you'd like to find a more advanced/ understanding teacher. I played piano for a little bit as a child, (also tiny hands gang) and it took me a long time to realize that my skills surpassed that of the teacher I had, so I had to move on. If anything, you turn 18 in two years and can end your lessons on your own, lol.

I'm friends with a lot of my officers, so even when I don't want to know, I end up being told one way or another. I'd rather know the ending of super important calls, like death under suspicious circumstances or child abuse investigations (so I know the kid is safe, of course). We also have access to read the reports afterwards, but I rarely go that route.

NTA. He's being weirdly controlling about this one specific thing and it's definitely not a hill I'd choose to die on if I were in his position. It's shady, but I'd tell him John's sleeping on the couch and just share a room anyway, personally.
Yeah, that's fair, but if he's potentially willing to leave OP over it regardless...

Courses are easy; job is hard. Florida dispatchers have to be state certified and it's a 120 hour course with mandatory minimum 20 hours retraining every two years. It's all basic common sense, until you're actually on the floor.
Yeah, yeah. Been up for 3 days, thinking is hard lol.

FL dispatcher here. Every agency has a different CritiCall test and most times the CritiCall isn't an accurate representation of the agency's actual systems or policies. I'm on the east coast and almost all of our local agencies require a 50+ WPM typing test, so work on that first. Familiarize yourself with the city/county you want to apply for and brush up on your map reading skills. Look into the curriculum for the Florida certification [on the FDOH website](http://www.floridahealth.gov/licensing-and-regulation/911-public-safety-telecommunicator-program/index.html); it'll be easier to learn it if you have at least a vague idea of what you're getting into.
We're not, but if you're asking regarding discounts or anything, as long as you have a department issued ID you'll more than likely get one lol

I listed friends that live in entirely different countries because many of my friends are not local. Some agencies look to make sure you put the references and then never bother to check up with them. List who you think will give the best representation of you!

WRITING.TITLE: Four hours left!
WRITING.TEXT: How's everyone else's night going?
We dispatch police, fire, and EMS and sometimes, on the fire/EMS console, I'll go my entire 12 hour shift without a single call to dispatch. Pretty sure I'm cursed at this point haha
For doing something.... good??? Wild. Hopefully it helped things in the long run!
Good! Hope you're enjoying it! your night off!
I wish it were the q- word here! Back to back foot pursuits for me and our officers are short-staffed tonight, haha
If you're in Florida, my agency's hiring lol
I found out as soon as I walked out of the room to tell my proctor I was finished

I moved there from Bithlo! But I recently moved back west lol. PSJ is nice, usually friendly neighbors, but there's not a lot to do there. Cocoa Village is close and has lots of stuff to do, like little shops sorta like Waterford, but smaller and more mom-and-pop-like.
We moved to be closer to my fianc #233; #8217;s work!

My agency just implemented a peer support team, so I'm not sure how helpful anything I say will be, but we all did an anonymous survey throughout the entire department (all the officers, records clerks, admin people, and dispatchers) to see who we all agreed were the best/easiest to talk to about our issues. Those people that were picked (and agreed to being on the team) send out a monthly email to just check on the people in their group. I've noticed this helped a lot because we picked people we were already comfortable with and those people go out of their ways to create a safe environment to talk in.

I haven't had to switch shifts in almost a year, but what I did to do it was force myself to stay up lol. I'm a natural night owl too, so when I got off work at 7am right before the switch, I stayed up as long as I could to make myself sleep during the night. It's probably not the healthiest thing to do, and it also can depend on your age from what I've been told, but it works for me lol

Unfortunately that's how the CTO program generally works. Be honest with her and tell her you learn best from a mix of positive feedback *and* constructive criticism. I had an awful experience with one of my CTOs and when I talked to her about it, she didn't even realize she's was being so negative.
Are you safe?

As a call taker, the worst call was a mother finding her 3 year old drowned in the pool in the backyard. As a dispatcher, sending units to a suspicious incident where a man was knocking on his neighbors door at 4am and the officers found out he was trying to tell his neighbor he #8217;d just killed his wife
